main event: A UFO sighting was reported in Beavertown, Ohio on August 4, 1956, where a very bright pin-point size object was observed directly overhead, making rapid and erratic course changes for 1 hour and 30 minutes.
interesting points: The object was reported to be very bright and small in size, observed to make rapid and erratic movements.
Observation lasted for a substantial duration of 1 hour and 30 minutes, allowing for detailed documentation of the sighting.
Details about the weather conditions, presence of other witnesses, and the observer's background were included in the questionnaire.
The observer indicated that the event was reported to some official, and multiple redacted names and addresses of other witnesses were included in the report.
The questionnaire also included questions about the observer's opinions on the observed object and their educational background.
sighted object: bright pin-point size object making rapid and erratic course changes
witnesses: single witness documented, redacted names and addresses of other witnesses provided
